contentrichtext.text: '''Ben Gurion''' may refer to: ==People with the surname== * [[Nicodemus ben Gurion]], a Biblical figure, wealthy Jew who lived in Jerusalem * [[David Ben-Gurion]] (1886–1973), the first Prime Minister of Israel * [[Paula Ben-Gurion]] (1892–1968), the Russian-born wife of David Ben-Gurion ==Other uses== * [[Ben Gurion International Airport]], the largest international airport in Israel ** [[Ben-Gurion International Airport Garden]], a garden outside Terminal 3 of Ben Gurion International Airport * [[Ben Gurion Airport Railway Station]], a station on the Israel Railways lines between Tel Aviv and Modi'in * [[Ben-Gurion University of the Negev]], a university in Israel with the main campus located in Beersheba *[[Midreshet Ben-Gurion]], an educational center and boarding school in Sde Boker in the Negev, Israel * [[Ben-Gurion House]], an historic house museum in Tel Aviv, Israel * [[Ben-Gurion National Solar Energy Center]], the national alternative energy research institute of Israel * [[Kiryat Ben-Gurion]], a complex of government buildings in the Givat Ram neighborhood of Jerusalem, Israel * [[Ben Gurion High School]], a high school in Petah Tikva, Israel * [[Ramot Ben Gurion]], a neighborhood in the city of Haifa, Israel == See also == * [[Gorion]] * [[Gurion Hyman]] (born 1925), Jewish Canadian annthropologist, linguist, pharmacist, composer, artist, and translator {{disambig|surname|geo}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Ben Gurion}} [[Category:Hebrew-language surnames]] [[Category:Surnames of Israeli origin]]
